task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula tool and push the pot toward the table front.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows a robot arm, a lidded pot, a white plate, a spatula-like tool, a large bowl, and a mock stovetop on a dark tablecloth. The robot must first open the pot by removing its lid, then grasp the pot and relocate it to the plate. After placing and releasing the pot, the robot must pick up the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table. Movements should remain collision-aware with gentle press forces when placing and controlled direction for the push.
preconditions: Objects visible: pot, lid, plate, spatula
Clearances around pot and plate sufficient for top grasp
Table front direction defined in task frame
stepwise_plan: Approach above the pot and open its lid
Compute and execute a top grasp on the pot
Lift and place the pot onto the plate, then release
Align to the pot and push it toward the front of the table
success_criteria: Lid is opened and left off the pot
Pot rests stably centered on the plate
Pot is pushed toward the front by at least the commanded distance
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan the workspace
If lid opening fails, re-approach and retry opening
If grasp slips, recompute grasp and retry
If push deviates, realign and re-push with reduced distance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the final retreat once the pot has been placed on the plate and pushed toward the front by the specified distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Search the workspace in a spiral to localize the pot.
Confirm perception and obtain pose of the pot.
Move above the pot at a safe pregrasp height.
Remove or open the lid from the pot.
Verify the pot is open (lid removed).
Compute a top-down grasp for the pot.
Execute the grasp on the pot.
Place the pot onto the plate surface with minimal force.
Back away to a safe distance.
Search to localize the spatula tool.
Confirm perception and obtain pose of the spatula.
Compute a pinch grasp for the spatula handle.
Align the tool to the pot for a straight push.
Push the pot toward the table front using the spatula.
Final retreat to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Pot or tool not detected due to glare or occlusion
Unstable pot grasp leading to slip
Push direction misaligned causing lateral drift
recovery_strategy: Re-run scan and detection with spiral pattern
Re-approach and retry lid opening with slight pose offset
Recompute grasp and adjust top strategy
Re-place with lower press_force and slower approach
assumptions: The contact sheet shows early interaction with the spatula before operating the pot; the BT follows the instruction order and notes this mismatch.
Front-of-table direction is mapped to direction_deg=180 in the task frame.
The white round dish is the 'plate' area for placement.
OpenContainer with container_type='lid' is sufficient to represent removing the pot lid.

expected_success_criteria: Lid removed, pot placed stably on plate, pot pushed forward by ~0.15 m, final retreat completed
